ovdesc.p: The Capital Increase Customer records are automatically generated by the System utilising the information stored within the Capital Increase Detail Application.

A separate record will be created for each customer position within a specified security and this file will contain all the relevant details applicable to that holding given the criteria specified within the Capital Increase Detail record.

The System will calculate the number of rights to which a customer is entitled and will illustrate the number of underlying new shares which those rights represent. Additionally, it will calculate the "rounded up" and "rounded down" number of shares to which a client is entitled with the various options available to him. Whether to buy additional rights enabling him to subscribe for the rounded up number or to sell the extra rights and merely subscribe to the rounded down number of shares.

The System allows the user to post any increases owing to a Capital Increase to either the existing security number or to a new security position again depending entirely on the information as set up in the "Detail" record.

t.desc:
Capital Increase Details automatically generated by the Criteria Selected in the detail record. Identifies uniquely each Capital Increase. Customer transaction.
Once the Capital Increase details key has been input and authorised the user will be able to access the customer records to enable an increase.
Examples: 123456-000.100104.CAP.20010327.100099-1.100.111
Validation Rules:
The Detail key is made up of the following format: NNNNNN-NNN - 6 numeric character Security Master number XXXXXX - 1-6 Numeric depository number NNN - 1-3 numeric Capital Increase Type number YYYYMMDD - Standard Date format NNNNNN-NNN - 1-6 numeric character Security Account Master number (Mandatory input) -
ZZZZZ 1-5 characters Nominee code (Optional) – SSSSSSSSSSSSSSSS 1-16 CHARACTERS
Sub Account
(Optional).
